bug.summary: Can't compile on macOS with brew-installed boost and boost-python
bug.description: I've just updated my ViZDoom version and even though it used to compile and work just fine, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mwydmuch/ViZDoom/commit/fbda2ab191c7fd113ba8458e030fb06133aa4642>fbda2ab</denchmark-link> seems to break the build for me . With this change it can no longer find boost-python. I installed the libraries using the following commands. I see that exists. brew install boost brew install boost-python --with-python3 Once I comment out this addtional set it compiles without any problems.

comments.comment: Sad, I hoped it would still work on mac. Without this line it breaks on linux so we will have to check it more thoroughly. Thanks for the note.
